overall_summary: The reasoning employs a median-based seasonal forecasting approach to handle clear daily patterns and outliers in limited data (96 hourly observations). It demonstrates moderate complexity by evaluating multiple statistical models (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) before settling on a robust median aggregation method to address anomalies while maintaining hourly seasonality patterns.
common_data_patterns: Stable hourly patterns with daily variations
No missing values in training data
key_insights: Using median instead of mean for hourly aggregation robustly handles outliers
Limited training data (4 days) constrains complex model selection
Explicit handling of anomalous negative values through robust statistics
Hourly pattern repetition as baseline forecasting mechanism
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-stage reasoning: initial model evaluation, detailed outlier examination, manual median calculations per hour, and format-aware implementation. Balances statistical methodology with practical implementation considerations.
